body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello, thank you for contacting Ocean View Hotels. My name is Benjamin Adams. May I have your name, please?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Hi Benjamin, my name is Marie Rivera.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Nice to meet you, Marie. Could you please provide me with your email address and phone number?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure, my email address is marie.rivera@example.com and my phone number is nine eight seven six five four three two one zero.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Marie. Can you confirm your date of birth and postal code for security purposes?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Of course, my date of birth is the first of January, one nine nine zero, and my postal code is A B C one two three.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great, thank you for providing that information, Marie. We will look into the pricing issue you mentioned.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You're welcome, Marie. Thank you for reaching out to us. Have a wonderful day!
